fields.description:
From [documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/PLUGINFRAMEWORK/Web+Item+Plugin+Module#WebItemPluginModule-linkElements]:

{quote}The absolute is optional and defaults to false unless the link starts with http:// or https://{quote}

I wanted to set url to '#', but this was changed into '/jira#'. In fact to set '#' I must do #set($x='#')$x but this is an velocity issue (using just '#' effects in velocity exception).

*How to reproduce*:
Just create web-item with link:
{code}
<web-item key="my-button" name="My Button" section="system.top.navigation.bar">
<label key="my-button.label"/>
<link linkId="my-link-id" absolute="true">im_absolute</link>
</web-item>
{code}

And check the value of href for this link. It will be prefixed by base URL.
fields.summary: DefaultSimpleLinkManager#getLinksForSection doesn't respects link's "absolute" argument

fields.description:
JIRA will deadlock when trying to get the next block of sequence numbers for a database id under some rare but reproducible circumstances.

This was discovered during development testing of the JIRA Archiver, to the best of our knowledge it has not been seen in the wild.

The specific case discovered was when a remote application concurrently sending requests to create remote issue links on 10 threads and JIRA was using the DBCP connection limit default settings of maxActive (connections) = 8.  This would cause JIRA to totally deadlock

Our, somewhat imperfect, understanding from examining the thread dumps from this scenario is that:
* 10 requests would arrive and each begin to add a remote link, taking a connection from the connection pool to do so.
* At some point one thread would cause the sequence generator to require new block of sequences
* The sequence generator would request a new connection from the pool.
* The remaining threads would block at SequenceUtil.SequenceBank.getNextSeqId(), which is a synchronised method
* At this stage all threads would start to march in lock step
* The threads would then move to writing a change history group and each would request a connection from the pool, not all would get a connection and some would be waiting.  We will call those that aquired a connection threads 'A' to 'H'. Threads 'I' and 'J' would be waiting.
* Thread 'A' would then require a sequence number calling SequenceUtil.SequenceBank.getNextSeqId() and needing to get a new block of ids would then request a connection from the pool to do so (It needs a new connection to do this so it is not in the transaction of the calling thread)
* Threads 'B' to 'H" are all now waiting on the syncronisation lock of SequenceUtil.SequenceBank.getNextSeqId() which is held by thread 'A' and so will never release a connection for thread 'A' to use.
* DEADLOCK
fields.summary: JIRA may deadlock when it receives a number of concurrent update requests that exceeds the database connection pool size.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30521].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 15 September 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
After discussion within the JIRA development team, we have decided not to implement this feature. The majority of use cases described are covered by JIRA Service Desk, which is a major investment by Atlassian to offer a great experience for serving customer requests, particularly the type created by emails. JIRA Service Desk offers email handlers to make this even easier.

While I understand that JIRA Service Desk is a paid product and may not be viable for all customers, realistically this issue will not become a priority for core JIRA development for the foreseeable future.

Remember that JIRA has an advanced plugin system and your license includes full access to JIRA source code, so if this is critical for you, it may be possible for you to modify your instance via other avenues.

We appreciate your understanding.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

When configuring an email handler, it is possible for us to specify the Default Reporter for creating issues from emails coming from an unknown sender. And at the moment, it is intended that the Default Reporter option will not be applied for emails coming from email addresses that has been registered in JIRA.

However, it will be great if the mail handler is able to check if the email sender have the permission to create issue in JIRA, if the user has already existed in JIRA database. And if the sender do not have the Create Issue permission, then create an issue from the mail and use the specified Default Reporter as the issue reporter. 

Sample use case: Sometimes JIRA is integrated with LDAP, and all LDAP users will be synchronized into JIRA. However, there may be a possibility that only half of the LDAP users is granted the permission to access JIRA, and the other half are not given the access to JIRA at all. And when the other half of the LDAP users is sending an email to create an issue, the emails will be rejected since the affected users do not have the appropriate permission in JIRA. 

Current workaround: Create a group in JIRA, and group the LDAP users that do not have the ability to login to JIRA, and grant the users (or the created group) the permission to Create Issue in the Permission Scheme - Does not work Post JIRA 7.
fields.summary: Use the Default Reporter configured in the mail handler when creating an issue from email, if the email sender already existed in JIRA and do not have the permission to create issues

h3. Reproduce

# Have a running *JIRA* instance that you want to upgrade to *JIRA 5.2*
# Perform the upgrade through the *JIRA* installer
# The result is that the *JIRA* service cannot be started

!error.png!

h3. Cause
The *path to executable* is still pointing to the old *Tomcat6w* instead of the new *Tomcat7w*

h3. Workaround

Please refer to our [JIRA 5.2 Service cannot be started with a "Error 2: The system cannot find the file specified"|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=312739859] KB article for instructions on how to workaround this issue.
fields.summary: JIRA 5.2 Installer Service is using Tomcat 6 instead of Tomcat 7

This issue is created after contact with the support : https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-142968

fields.description:
Currently a user needs 'browse projects' permission to see a project's avatar. A user without this permission that /does/ have 'create issues' permission cannot see the project avatar.

When they create an issue, the project drop-down will list the projects they are able to create issues in, but the project avatars will be blank for those they cannot browse. Behind the scenes, this results in many AJAX requests that result in 403 errors.

This should be changed so that users with 'create issues' permission for a project can view its avatar too.
fields.summary: A project's avatar should be visible to users with 'create issues' permission

fields.description:
Date searchers' view html is constructed by concatenating i18n keys such as navigator.filter.duedate.after, navigator.hidden.search.request.summary.date.ago. This concatenation makes assumptions about grammar that are true for english but not necessarily true for other languages.

Change so date searcher view html text is always constructed using i18n keys that are full sentences, not concatenations of multiple subkeys.
fields.summary: Remove concatenation used to create view text / tooltip for date searchers

Currently https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Migrating+from+Other+Issue+Trackers has information on how to use the [JIRA Importers Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-importers-plugin], however it lists the [JIRA Redmine Importer|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-importers-redmine-plugin] as not being supported [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Migrating+from+Other+Issue+Trackers#MigratingfromOtherIssueTrackers-4.RequestsforNon-SupportedImporters] and   links to [JIM-254|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JIM-254] which was resolved on 26/Oct/12 with the creation of the Redmine importer.

The problem is we still list it as being unsupported and have no docs for that plugin, which is actually supported by us. I have raised [JIM-860|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JIM-860] for the plugin devs to put together some docs, however we need to get those docs and put them on CAC so I have raised this issue.

Can you please update https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Migrating+from+Other+Issue+Trackers as well as JIRA050 and JIRA051 to have these docs? The plugin is available from 5.0.2 to 5.2.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Update the JIRA Importers Plugin docs to include Redmine Importer docs

1) Go to any JIRA Browse Project page(Summary, Issues, or any other panel).
2) Type in the key for any other JIRA issue (or anything else, for that matter) in the Quick Search Box on the top right corner of the page.
3) Press Enter.

*Expected Behavior*
You are taken to the requested page without warning.

*Actual Behavior*
You are warned about navigating away from the page, as if you made changes you did not save.

fields.description:
The following report came to sales@atlassian.com from a customer:
---

We are using Jira in Finland and when setting the Due Date of an issue, the system writes the first letter of the month name with a capital letter. This is not accepted and it has to be changed manually. For example '7/Marras/12' and I have to change it as '7/marras/12' (Marraskuu means November).
fields.summary: Format issues when setting Due Date of an Issue
Switch to advanced does not put the cursor in the JQL field

fields.description:
The problem in particular is that indexing an issue in JIRA happens due to an event listener listening to an issue event.  Publishing webhooks also happens as the result of an event listener listening to an issue event.  The order in which listeners get notified of these events is not deterministic however! So it can happen that sometimes the webhook publisher will be notified first and try to run the JQL filter *before* the issue has been reindexed!

Steps to reproduce:
* Setup a webhook with JQL filter
* Setup a listener for the webhook so you can check if the webhook gets sent (I just used tcpmon to proxy the request from port 8989 to port 80 on my local box)
* Create an issue (or whatever) to trigger the webhook

*Sometimes* no webhook will be sent.  You can also simulate this by setting a breakpoint in the IssueIndexListener, thus simulating a slow index operation.
fields.summary: Webhooks JQL filtering may not always match

fields.description: Our JIRA installation includes two projects with numbers in their project keys: SC1 and SC2. Linking and searching for these issues by their issue ID doesn't work. For example, if there is an issue "SC1-56", entering that in the search results in no matching issues. Similarly, a link won't be created to the issue if it is mentioned in a comment.
fields.summary: Can't search for issues when project key ends in a number

fields.description:
On jira.atlassian.com, I often get logged out overnight because there is a script someone in the internet that is trying to log in as me (it's my fault). Before JIRA 5.2, I would just need to re-log in once and it would be fine. Now, I have to answer several (between 6 and 10) CAPTCHAs before it will allow me to log in again.

This could be circumstantial or it could be a change in the login code in JIRA 5.2.

  {panel}

Copied from https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JIM-857

When the user chooses to create a demo project in an ondeamnd instance which does not include FECRU, the Confluence space is not created

This affects jira-ondemand-jim-bridge-plugin-1.3

The OnDemandCreateProjectHandler should be checking for which other products exist in the ondemand instance, something like this:
{code}

        builder.id(project.getId()).homeUrl(project.getUrl())
                .hasConfluence(appStatusService.isAppEnabled(Application.CONFLUENCE) && canCreateAssociatedEntityFor(Application.CONFLUENCE,getRemoteUser().getName()))
                .hasFeCru(appStatusService.isAppEnabled(Application.FISHEYE)&& canCreateAssociatedEntityFor(Application.FISHEYE,getRemoteUser().getName()))
                .hasBamboo(appStatusService.isAppEnabled(Application.BAMBOO) && canCreateAssociatedEntityFor(Application.BAMBOO,getRemoteUser().getName()));
{code}

But instead it uses the default settings, which assume that FeCru exists.

When Confluence is asked to create a project by JIRA, it looks at the project spec and fails to validate it, because FeCru is not actually there.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30467].
  {panel}

Assuming the following:
# I have a project named _PROJECT_ with key _PROJ_
# I create a filter:
{code}
project = PROJECT
{code}
# If I rename _PROJECT_ to _NEWPROJECT_ then the field produces
!error.png!

*Suggestion*:
Is it possible to bind the search to the project key or issue type ID instead? That way, renaming a project should leave filters unaffected.

*Workaround*
# Look for all filters using the old project name in the database
{code:SQL}select * from searchrequest where reqcontent like '%PROJECT%';{code}
# Edit the filters to update the project or issue type names

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30462].
  {panel}

Big companies work differently than small companies.  If JIRA is to be effectively used by large, reliable, predictable, accountable companies, and not small ad hoc development teams "where anything goes", then JIRA must have support for business logic that goes beyond a required field here, or a workflow condition there.

Proper support for business logic means allowing the tool to have custom logic applied *before* any edit happens, so that changes to issues can be validated against business logic, appropriate for the enterprise JIRA is being used in.

Some examples:

- You might want fields to be valid in the context of values of other 
  fields.

- You might want dynamic conditions.

- You might want approval processes to be invoked, a certain role 
  may be able to lock/unlock certain fields, potentially at different
  points in the lifecycle.

- You may want fields to conform to certain formats for legal reasons.

- etc.

Support business logic at the enterprise level comes down to allowing plugin authors to gate/stop edits before they are made to JIRA issues.  

We are not asking you to implement business logic in JIRA, we are asking you to make it possible for that class of problems to be addressed by plugins.

JIRA must provide the ability to stop or alter *all* edits, not just provide notification that changes are happening.

How JIRA is failing to do this now:

Plugins can listen to changes but not actually stop or alter them.  All edits (all of them) need to be preceded by a pending edit hook of some kind to give plugins a chance to gate the edit or alter it.

This can not be done right now.  The closest you can get is using the JIRA Behaviors plugin or writing something similar where you can control the edits being made in the browser via Javascript validation, and/or in combination with server side processing.

This *fails* to provide complete support though.  A user can easily subvert business logic enforced through JavaScript:

1) do a bulk edit

2) do inline editing (if the javascript doesn't handle inline editing)

3) do edits through remote API

4) do edits through plugins (like GreenHopper)

So while a plugin such as JIRA Behaviors (which is awesome by the way), works great, it can't possibly provide *true* business logic support, no plugin can.  There is no way to gate/stop edits to issues in a way that is consistent and guaranteed to always apply.

So, ideally JIRA should provide an internal hook to plugins, which allows plugins to gate/stop/alter edits *before* they are made. 

For now though, you could solve 90% of the problem by providing a pre-edit hook inside Bulk edit.  JIRA Behaviors will likely add inline edit support, GH is using the built in edit screens now I think, and if they do remote editing...well we can tolerate that.  

So just adding a Bulk Edit pre-edit hook for plugins would solve most the problem.

Again, I want to be clear, this is absolutely necessary for enterprise customers.  Large companies focus on being predictable, reliable and accountable.  To do this, we have to enforce certain practices in JIRA, that can not be enforced simply by adding workflow conditions or configuring a few field screens.  We don't expect you to implement business logic, just that you make it possible for us to get it done, either by plugin providers or on our own.

If Atlassian is serious about addressing the enterprise market, this feature should be at the top of your queue.  Big companies work differently than small companies.

Even if you don't believe the enterprise argument (which you should), then for Agile to be a mature and disciplined approach, you still need this. Otherwise I don't think you can claim Agile is maturing.

fields.description:
Cancel Link is not working when using the JIRA-5.1.7-language-pack-pl_PL.jar file on the local polish machine, ONLY reproduceable on the local polish language environment.

Steps to reproduce:
# Shut down JIRA
# Copy the JIRA-5.1.7-language-pack-pl_PL.jar in the Home/plugin/installed plugin
# Start JIRA
# Set the JIRA langues to polish. 
# Create a issue and click on any transition, for example, Resolve issue
# After the resolve issue screen jump out, when you click 'cancel' button. Nothing happens and it won't be cancel. User have to use 'Esc' to exit the page. 
!cancel.JPG|thumbnail!

However, there is a workaround for this:
You can edit the jar file as following:
# Extract the JIRA-5.1.7-language-pack-pl_PL.jar
# Open {{JIRA-5.1.7-language-pack-pl_PL.jar\com\atlassian\jira\web\action\JiraWebActionSupport_pl_PL.properties}}
# Search for
{noformat}
AUI.form.cancel.link.accesskey="
{noformat}
and change it to:
{noformat}
AUI.form.cancel.link.accesskey='
{noformat}
# Generagte a new jar file for your changes.

OR

Download the JIRA-5.1.7-language-pack-pl_PL.jar file in this ticket, which it has already been modified.
fields.summary: Cancel link access key is not working when using the polish language pack from TAC

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug
When cloning an issue, if there is a validator located in the workflow that is not fulfilled, JIRA will proceed with the cloning process anyway, and the clone process will end with the issue being linked to itself.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a new workflow (or copy an existing one), without adding any new validators
# Create a new workflow scheme
# Assign the new workflow to the new scheme
# Create a project, and use the new workflow scheme 
# Create an issue in the new project
# Create a draft of the workflow, and insert a validator in the 'Create' transition such that a field is set as 'Required' during the transition (this is done using the JIRA Suite Utilities plugin)
# Publish the draft
# Access the existing issue, and try to clone it

!clone 1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Issue will be cloned back to itself if validator is not fulfilled

fields.description:
I was trying to add the "reporter" criteria to a search.  Here is what I did.

# click on more criteria.
# type "reporter"
# hit enter to select this criteria.  I was then presented with the open sparkler for Reporter.
# I typed "jcreen", down arrow to pick JC, hit enter, then escape and the sparkler closed.
# The criteria lozenge correctly showed "Reporter: jcreenaune" but the results list did NOT honour that criteria.  ie there were issues listed from other reporters.

So...

# I clicked on the Reporter sparkler.
# I unclicked "JCreenaune", then I clicked it again.
# This time I waited until the listed issues had changed
# Then I hit esc to close the sparkler.

I don't want to have to wait before I hit esc to close the sparkler!!
fields.summary: New sparkler criteria not taking effect if I do things quickly.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30452].
  {panel}

As support we find that the multitudes of different configurations with customers environments can be difficult to work with when things are not standard.

One of the things is where our customers decide to put their JIRA install and JIRA home directories. These often also either get forgotten by customers, or hands change for the organisations responsibility of JIRA, and the person who set up JRIA is no longer the person who maintains JIRA when trouble is run into.

One particular difficulty is helping a customer out with connecting to their own HSQL database:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+HSQLDB

We tend to use the $JIRA_HOME and $JIRA_INSTALL variables lots in our docs, can these environment variables be set up as a standard when installing through the .bin/windows installer (or even in start-jira.sh scripts)
fields.summary: Environment Variables for $JIRA_HOME and $JIRA_INSTALL

fields.description:
from the [5.2 EAP feedback issue:|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-29474?focusedCommentId=413069&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-413069]

I've just noticed that in m06 Mail Handler popup configuration seems to have lost the ability to access the 'com/atlassian/jira/plugins/mail/ServiceConfiguration' class that is available in 5.1.6, this breaks configuration of JEMH. The class is still present in the jira-mail parent plugin, but seems to no longer resolve within my p2 plugin. This class is used to retrieve the context of the popup, to re-select a previously saved configuration selection.
A diff of the jira-mail's atlassian-plugin.xml between versions doesn't show up anything that would cause this.
fields.summary: Mail Handler popup configuration seems to have lost the ability to access the 'com/atlassian/jira/plugins/mail/ServiceConfiguration' class

fields.description:
jira.permission.assignable.reporter workflow property is also listing the current Assignee in the assignable user list

It's possible for us to allow only issue Reporter to be assigned to an issue when executing a workflow transition, by using the {{jira.permission.assignable.reporter}} workflow property. By applying the property, we are expecting that only the Reporter to be list down in the Assignee field, however we may found that actually the current assignee (different that the Reporter) will be listed as well. 

Since the expected behavior is to have only the Reporter to be listed, it is great if we can remove the current assignee from the list as well. 

Some sample screenshot, the workflow property is applied to the Resolved status:
- When some other user (admin) is the current Assignee of an issue, we can see that the user will be listed as an assignable user:
!scshot1.png!
- But if the Reporter is also the current Assignee, we can only see the Reporter name as the assignable user in the list:
!scshot2.png!
fields.summary: Unassignable users are shown in the assignee dropdowns

fields.description:
We should be able to override the Assignable User permission in the permission scheme by using workflow properties, {{jira.permission.assignable.*}}. The property can either be applied in workflow statuses or transition, and we can limit the list of the Assignee based on project role by using the following property:
- jira.permission.assignable.projectrole

Though the property works as intended in most of workflow transitions or statuses, apparently it's not working as expected if we apply the property in the Create Issue transition. Things to note here is that the property will not work when using the auto-complete Assignee field, however if we switch the field to use the old style 'Dropdown', then the property works as intended. 

Some sample screenshot illustrating the behavior:
- The Assignee list is displaying all potential assignable user, although we have applied the workflow property to only list down the project role of the ID 10100:
!scshot1.png!
- But if we use the drop down list by setting the {{frother.assignee.field = false}}, we get the expected results:
!scshot2.png!

(i) Only 2 users is expected to be listed in the Assignee list after applying the workflow property

Tested on JIRA 5.1.7
fields.summary: jira.permission.assignable.projectrole workflow property is not working in the Create Issue transition

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30448].
  {panel}

when you go through the whats new video tour for the JIRA 5.2 release every video starts with a 10 second Atlassian + JIRA intro trailer

http://cl.ly/image/420Z3H3x3u2a

This is really annoying after you've seen the first one. I understand we are trying to re-use the videos on WAC as well as on the whats new feature tour.

Suggestion: In Youtube, you can embed videos and start at a specific time. So in the Whats new page, just start the videos after the 10 second intro so you don't have to watch that 3 times every time.
fields.summary: Every video in the JIRA "whats new" video for 5.2 displays the JIRA trailer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-30447].
  {panel}

By default, JIRA requires that a user has the *Browse Project* permission for mail notifications to go out.  The Notification Helper does not seem to make this check.

!browse permission - null.png|thumbnail!
!notification helper - check.png|thumbnail!

With the above checks, Notification Helper indicates that the testuser should get an e-mail when a comment is made.  This is not the case, no e-mail is sent out.
fields.summary: Notification Helper does not check Browse Project permissions
Replace PermissionsArrayTransformer with a REST resource
Replace NotificationEventsTransformer with a REST resource
